message: I created this site as a way for developers and designers to share links without the other stuff (off-topic, non-links, etc.) that sites like Twitter present. I'd love to get feedback on the site and see what people think of it.

I think you should optimize your download by combining your css and javascript into single downloads. It's not hard with a small python script. You might then want to give uglifier or closure compiler a gander and minify the javascript. It's not a bad design, but all the tabs load very slowly. What's the underlying technology?
I think if you're a link sharing site you should be putting lots of links on the front page like Reddit or Hacker News does.  Rather than having the big signup form be the first thing users see.
The url pointing to user page is not so pretty. You could replace the 'user id' it is showing by some 'user slug' or 'user username'. Otherwise, good luck with your startup!
I'd agree, put more links on the first page, whats what people seem to want.
@apphacker What's wrong Varnish? I've only heard good things about it.
We opened Beta Sign ups!!! www.streamerapp.cpm
@diegotwix can you stop spamming every topic i mean really just for that i am not clicking on the link
@diegotwix yeah dude, not cool. Make your own topic and quit spamming everyone else.
nothing is wrong with varnish, was just asking about your tech and remarked about what I saw
